item.title: Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2022
Supreme Court Security Funding Act of 2022
Further Additional Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2023

item.text: On motion to table the motion to reconsider Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 201 - 192 (Roll no. 234).
Mr. McGovern moved to table the motion to reconsider.
Mr. Raskin moved to reconsider the vote on agreeing to the resolution.
Motion to reconsider laid upon the table. Objection heard.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 208 (Roll no. 233). (text: CR H4095-4096)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 208 (Roll no. 233).(text: CR H4095-4096)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 208 (Roll no. 232).
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 567.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H4105-4107)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 567.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H4095-4104)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 29.
Provides for consideration of H.R. 4346, H.R. 4373, and H.R. 4505 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate for each bill.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-110, by Mr. Morelle.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-110, by Mr. Morelle.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4346) making appropriations for Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4373) making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4505) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022.

This resolution sets forth rules for

  • consideration of H.R. 4346 making appropriations for Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022;
  • consideration of H.R. 4373 making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022; and
  • consideration of H.R. 4505 making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4346) making appropriations for Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4373) making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4505) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2022, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
